result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Jury Trial scheduled for March 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gregg H. Novack not in court.  Attorney Jacob Corr for Michael Christopher Schindhelm in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case calendared for Status Hearing this date.  Attorney Novack did not appear prior to case being called.  Court adjourns matter for status and jury trial.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense; signed, filed, and distributed. 
Attorney Gregg Novack

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in Court, in custody. Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr on behalf of Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status of Counsel hearing with Defendant's other Case, 22CF767. Co-Defendant Case, 22CF40, also scheduled today. Discussion placed on the record. State Public Defender's Office failed to timely appoint counsel for the Defendant. Statements by Defendant. For reasons stated on the record, Court found Defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel at COUNTY EXPENSE. Court appointed Attorney Gregg Novack to represent Defendant in this matter at County Expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court ordered the Defendant is NOT REQUIRED to reimburse Milwaukee County; however, Court ordered the Defendant to pay a one-time fee of $60.00 by the completion of the case. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing, Branch 46. 

Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:45 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Dequaylow W Buros in Court with Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang. Defendant Dequaylow W Buros in custody.  Attorney William T. Berens on behalf of Attorney Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in Court for Plea hearing with Defendants other Case, 22CF767. Defendant also has Case 22CF544 in Branch 9. Court reviewed Defense Motion to Withdraw. Discussion placed on the record. Court held colloquy with Defendant. Court GRANTED Defense Motion to Withdraw. Court ordered case adjourned for Status of Counsel hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Information provided to the Public Defender's Office.  Status of Counsel hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
-received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Clerk contacted the parties via email to reschedule Plea hearing.
NEW DATE: Plea hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm. 
Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Correspondence dated August 4, 2022 from Defense; received and filed.

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang. Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in custody.  Eric Bashirian on behalf of Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Status hearing with CO-DEFENDANT (Tucker 22CF40). Defendant also has Case 22CF767 in Branch 46 and Case 22CF544 in Branch 17. Defense has received Global offer and is requesting Plea hearing. Judge Feiss, Branch 46 will accept Case 22CF544 for GLOBAL RESOLUTION. Case adjourned for Plea hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Plea hearing scheduled August 9, 2022 at 9:15 am. Hearing will be held in room 113 of Safety Building.

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in custody. Brittany S Kachingwe appeared on behalf of Michael Christopher Schindhelm for the State of Wisconsin.

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Status hearing with CO-DEFENDANT (Tucker 22CF40). Defendant also has Case 22CF767 in Branch 46 and Case 22CF544 in Branch 17. Discussion placed on the record. Parties negotiating and advised the Court of possible global resolution. Defense requested time to receive and review possible global resolution. Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 11:15 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in Court with Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference with CO-DEFENDANTS (Mann 22CF39 and Tucker 22CF40). Defendant also has Case 22CF767 in Branch 46 and Case 22CF544 in Branch 17. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense requested time to review case with Defendant. Parties negotiating and advised the Court of possible global resolution. Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:45 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in court with Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang; both appear by video.  Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in custody.  Jennifer Tate appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective. J. Sullivan. Court took judicial notice of the defendants prior adjudication. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

-received and filed. 
Attorney Manuel Galang

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks not in court, defendant in custody.  Michael Schindhelm appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks not in court, defendant in custody.   Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no contact with Leatrice T.H., Kimp L.W.No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Dequaylow W Burks in custody.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dequaylow W Burks appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 6.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
